title: Acrylonitrile Butadiene Styrene (ABS)
description: ABS is a highly-functional plastic known for its strong heat resistance and impact resistance. It is used in numerous areas including toys such as automobiles, IT devices, etc.

title: Nylon Granules
description: Nylon is the plastic material based on polyamide-6 that is a thermoplastic resin with excellent mechanical, thermal and electrical properties. Nylon is widely used in the manufacture of automobile and industrial parts.

title: Polyoxymethylene (POM)
description: POM is a material of an excellent quality with features of excellent anti-friction/anti-wear, chemical-resistance, heat-resisting stability, precise dimensions and moulding abilities.

title: Polycarbonates (PC)
description: Polycarbonate, an amorphous polymer, offers a unique combination of toughness with exceptional impact strength. It also exhibits high optical clarity, excellent creep, and high temperature resistance.

title: Poly Methyl Methacrylate
description: Super transparent, amorphous PMMA offers high resistance to UV light and weathering, chemical and heat resistance, long service life, and unlimited colouring options for various applications.

title: Poly Vinyl Chloride (PVC)
description: A durable and long-lasting material that can be used in a variety of applications, either rigid or flexible: building and construction, medical devices and food packaging.

title: Polystyrene (PS)
description: A transparent polymer used in a variety of applications, such as food packaging and appliances. Polystyrene foams are used for thermal insulation and protective packaging.

title: Polybutylene Terephthalate (PBT)
description: Dimensional stability, low warpage, weatherable, excellent chemical resistance and high quality surface finish & gloss.

title: Polypropylene (PP)
description: Complete range of Homo, Random & Impact Polypropylene and Polypropylene Compounds for Flexible and Rigid Applications.
